dcterms:creator: Catalin Ionescu
Dragos Papava
Vlad Olaru
Cristian Sminchisescu
dcterms:description: The Human3.6M dataset is the most popular human motion dataset used for benchmarking the pose prediction task. It contains 3.6 million poses and each pose is represented using a skeleton composed of 32 joints. It consists of 15 actions such as walking, phoning, and eating performed by 7 subjects.
dcterms:title: H3.6M

dcterms:creator: CMU Graphics Lab
dcterms:description: The CMU-Mocap dataset contains motion data of humans performing various actions such as running, walking, and jumping. The poses are represented using a skeleton composed of 38 joints.
dcterms:title: CMU Mocap
